title: El violador eres tú | Jéssica Fillol | TEDxVitoriaGasteiz
video_description:
Jéssica Fillol nos da pistas sobre quién comete la mayor parte de los delitos de violación y no son precisamente encapuchados en callejones oscuros.
 Especialista en marketing online, estudiante de ciencias sociales, activista en los ratos libres y curiosa a tiempo completo. Mete la pata con frecuencia y no le duele cambiar de opinión: es de esas personas que cree que un experto es aquel que ha cometido todos los errores posibles en un determinado campo. “Demasiado feminista” según algunos, “demasiado radical” según otros. Se dedicó al marketing para comerse el mundo, estudió ciencias sociales para entenderlo, y hace activismo para cambiarlo. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Bettering the Creative Industries of Tomorrow | Will Kennard | TEDxWarwick
video_description:
After forming Chase and Status, Will decided to focus solely on their music. In that time Will taught music technology at North Trafford College for two years part time, and he remarks that the talent of the students from underprivileged backgrounds at that college was his inspiration to found the East London Arts and Music School (ELAM) in 2014.

The school is in Tower Hamlets, one of the poorest areas in East London, and the aim of the school is to develop the musical talent in the area for 16-19 year old students from socially disadvantaged backgrounds.

Will talks about educational inequalities, social mobility and the role that creativity plays in shaping the lives of young people, with the belief that music is a central way to educate the next generation. Will 'Status' Kennard is one half of the infamous music duo, Chase and Status, that is responsible for propelling the drum and bass genre into mass popularity with chart-topping hits such as 'Blind Faith' and 'End Credits'. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Kõiki kaasav disain | Daniel Kotsjuba | TEDxTallinn
video_description:
Igal inimesel on elu jooksul mõni erivajadus: kui kannad prille, oled lapsevanem või vananed, siis kuulud mingil hetkel erivajadustega inimeste hulka. Kui disainida keskkonda nii, et arvestada juba eos kõigi erivajadustega, siis ei peagi enam tegelema ligipääsetavusega. Selle eelduseks on muidugi inimeste mõistmine.
 Disainer, kes usub, et inimeste mitmekesisuses peitub võimalus kuidas luua uudseid ning paremaid lahendusi, millest võidavad kõik. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Igaühe looduskaitse | Aveliina Helm | TEDxTallinn
video_description:
Maailma elurikkuse seis on täna lausa katastroofiline: iga kaheksas liik on väljasuremisohus. Euroopas pole ühtki ökosüsteemi, kus oleks elurikkuse olukord paranenud, trend on samas suunas ka Eestis. Ometi ei ole see paratamatu ja iga inimene saab sinna oma panuse anda. 
 Looduseuurija, kes soovib luua tulevikku, kus hea elu ja looduse säilimine on ühendatud. Aveliina toimetab Tartu Ülikoolis vanemteadurina, õppejõuna, bioloogi ja looduskaitseteadlasena. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Rebirth | 子丰 戢 | TEDxYongqingSt
video_description:
All presuppositions are unimportant because we want to open a window. Let the sunshine pour into the endless suffering of our life. Only in this way can we separate the moment from the long life pattern,
Separate the moment of anger, the moment of love, the moment of identification and betrayal, the moment of desire, or just the moment of silence.
In these moments, we can believe that we are kinder, quieter and more complete than we actually are, and that we can be independent and strong.
It is only because we believe in such a moment that our life is unique and irreplaceable. This is "rebirth". 毕业于北京电影学院（本科）
美国顶级艺术学院Art Center College of Design（硕士）
全国新概念作文大赛一等奖 中国少年作家杯一等奖
北京电影学院2012年度导演系优秀作品
入围2015年韩国青龙青电影节青年展映单元
曾就职于B站总播放量过亿的狮林影视公司
拍摄数部播放量过百万的影视作品，作品包括
短片《朋友列传》
短片《克伦威尔星》
网络剧《二次元奇妙物语》
网络大电影《古镇疑云》
网络综艺《网络观察室》
手游布武天下广告片《傲皇》
华为荣耀广告片《荣耀大侦探》
网络综艺《故事盖浇饭》
网络剧《熊志凌云》
2019年成立属于自己的杰杰丰影视公司，以创造有趣文化产品为自己的小目标，为大家带来快乐，奉送欢笑和喜悦。 This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Resilience | 泊林Ella 余YU | TEDxYongqingSt
video_description:
The speech is mainly about the psychological change and acceptance process of her family moving to the United States from junior high school, and after fully integrating into the local environment, she suddenly returned to China to continue high school due to the change of family plan. Has previously studied in the United States for three years and is the founder of her own podcast "Ella Talks," on "Ximalaya." 
A passionate writer and poet who published proses and poems relating to social justice and more. 
An active tennis player on the school's team and has won recognitions and awards in United States.
Volunteered to help promote Chinese culture at fairs and has taught elementary kids Chinese. 
As a classical music lover, Ella also participates in piano competitions, recitals, and talent shows anually.

曾经在美国留学三年，在喜马拉雅上创立自己的英文播客”Ella Talks”。平时热爱写作并在多个线上杂志发表散文，诗等。喜欢打网球，在校曾是活跃的网球队队员，在赛季参与多次校际联赛并获奖项。在美国时，曾领导学校中文社并经常在各个志愿者活动中宣传中国文化和教小学学生中文。从小喜欢音乐，学习钢琴十多年，每年参加钢琴比赛，演出数十场。 This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Rebirth | 邦平 肖 | TEDxYongqingSt
video_description:
The speech tells his entrepreneurial story and share with us how he overcame unexpected difficulties and achieved phased success. 毕业于南加州大学物理系
曾获国家物理奥林匹克竞赛一等奖
大二创办CIS学术科研项目，至今有包含哈佛，耶鲁，普利斯顿在内超过300位常春藤终身荣誉及院长级教授在工科/理科/人文/商科领域通过该项目为国内超过6000位学生提供科研及学术项目指导，近60%学生获得美国前50录取，藤校录取率超25% This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Qui suis je ? Le rôle des figures d’attachement et de l’école.. | Vitoria Fernandes | TEDxPoitiers
video_description:
Qui sommes-nous ? Lors de plusieurs voyages autour du globe, au sein de différentes familles et d’institutions pour enfants, une grande remise en question s’effectue : qui sommes-nous ? Et pourquoi sommes-nous ainsi ? Que pouvons-nous changer pour améliorer le bien-être et le bon développement de soi et des autres ? En particulier à l’école. 
Le challenge de cette enseignante passionnée de neurosciences : prouver que nous avons un impact direct sur le développement des autres, et prendre conscience de ce qui nous a développé, et de ce qui a construit la personne, que nous pensons être aujourd’hui. Vitoria Fernandes est une jeune professeur des écoles, passionnée de neurosciences et psychologie, elle a souvent remarqué l’impact des mots et des différentes méthodes d’enseignements sur les enfants et leur bien-être. Elle décide alors de partir 1 an autour du monde pour apprendre et découvrir les différentes méthodes et mentalités liées au développement. 
Tout une remise en question s’effectue alors sur l’impact que nous avons dans la construction de soi et des autres. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Reviving the Culture of Accountability  | Chirangee Tisssera | TEDxNegombo
video_description: Chirangee Tissera talks about why we should be accountable for our actions and the importance of spreading a culture of accountability. Founder and CEO of ConsltEd This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: As várias dimensões dos seres humanos | Danny Zahreddine | TEDxPUCMinasLive
video_description: Danny Zahreddine é professor e pesquisador. Possui graduação em Relações Internacionais e em Turismo pela PUC Minas. É mestre e doutor em Geografia - Tratamento da Informação Espacial pela PUC Minas. É Diretor do Instituto de Ciências Sociais da PUC Minas e professor do Departamento de Relações Internacionais, atuando como professor do corpo permanente do Programa de Pós-graduação e da graduação. Além disto, é professor do curso de Pós-graduação em Estudos Diplomáticos do Centro de Direito Internacional (CEDIN) e líder do Grupo de Pesquisa Oriente Médio e Magreb do CNPQ. Tem experiência na área de Relações Internacionais, atuando principalmente nos temas de política externa brasileira, política internacional e geopolítica. Possui graduação em Relações Internacionais e em Turismo pela PUC Minas. É mestre e doutor em Geografia - Tratamento da Informação Espacial pela PUC Minas. É Diretor do Instituto de Ciências Sociais da PUC Minas e professor do Departamento de Relações Internacionais, atuando como professor do corpo permanente do Programa de Pós-graduação e da graduação. Além disto, é professor do curso de Pós-graduação em Estudos Diplomáticos do Centro de Direito Internacional (CEDIN) e líder do Grupo de Pesquisa Oriente Médio e Magreb do CNPQ. Tem experiência na área de Relações Internacionais, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Política externa brasileira, política internacional, Fundamentos em Relações Internacionais, geopolítica, focos de tensão, sistemas de informações geográficas e geodemografia. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Be a Category of One | Simon Severino | TEDxOsogbo
video_description: Simon shares how to achieve your widest dreams by focusing on individual uniqueness and superpower. Simon introduces the concept of the equalizer that can help to build incomparable individuals in various field by focusing on their uniqueness. Simon Severino This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: A Construção da Coragem | Igor Cosso | TEDxBeloHorizonte
video_description: A jornada do herói é uma metodologia bastante conhecida no cinema e nos livros, mas também faz parte da vida de toda pessoa, especialmente, ao sair da zona de conforto. Ao refletir sobre esses momentos decisivos, o ator Igor Cosso, explora a coragem de fazer mudanças. Aborda a revelação de ser parte da comunidade LGBT como inspiradora para conectar consigo e com os outros de forma mais genuína. Igor Cosso faz um convite para "que você construa sua coragem." Igor Cosso é ator e escritor belo-horizontino conhecido por seus trabalhos na TV e no teatro. Atualmente interpreta o Júnior na novela “Salve-se Quem Puder” e produz a sequência de short-films “The Article”.  Recentemente, Igor se tornou uma referência por sua coragem ao romper os padrões dentro do seu mercado de trabalho e anunciar que é parte da comunidade LGBTQIA+. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Les cellules souches : un outil prometteur et excitant ! | Clara Steinchen | TEDxPoitiers
video_description: Leur capacité à se multiplier à l’infini et à devenir d’autres types cellulaires confèrent aux cellules souches des propriétés uniques… Mais que peut-on vraiment attendre de ces cellules ? Pourra-t-on vraiment soigner toutes les maladies dans l’avenir avec des cellules souches ? Voir créer des organes artificiels ou faire naitre des bébés OGM ?  Clara Steichen est chercheuse à Poitiers, titulaire d’un doctorat sur le sujet. Elle va vous montrer, que les cellules souches sont, pour la médecine de demain, un outil prometteur et excitant, mais aussi troublant…  Clara Steichen est chercheuse post-doctorante à Poitiers et s'intéresse au potentiel des cellules souches humaines. Après une école d'ingénieur en biotechnologies, un doctorat en région parisienne et une expérience post-doctorale de 2 ans au Brésil, elle rejoint le laboratoire IRTOMIT (Inserm U1082, Université de Poitiers) au CHU de Poitiers qui s'intéresse à la transplantation d'organe, dans le but d'appliquer ses connaissances sur les cellules souches pour développer de nouveaux modèles ou stratégies thérapeutiques dans ce contexte. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Siempre podemos dar 10 más | Fausto Murillo | TEDxRosario
video_description: Fausto nos enseña a proponernos metas, a sudar por ellas y a superarlas. Siempre con una sonrisa ante las dificultades, su historia arranca desde muy abajo y termina con un sueño cumplido: ayudar a las personas a adoptar un modo de vida saludable. Después de un largo período fuera de su país, Fausto regresó a Colombia con el afán de animar a llevar un estilo de vida saludable. Todos los días desde las 6:30 hasta las 8:30 am, brinda clases aeróbicas gratuitas en un polideportivo de Bello. Al mismo tiempo creó Turbosteps, una página para brindar apoyo deportivo. Su estilo alegre y motivacional, llevó a que millones de personas lo sigan en una gran comunidad digital y logren sus metas. Un dato extra: Fausto además, ha sido modelo de pasarela, y bailarín. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Out of the Shadows: Women Veterans and Homelessness | Lily Casura | TEDxSanAntonioWomen
video_description:
Women are one of the fastest-growing demographics in today's US military. During and after their military service, women face unique challenges that can lead to homelessness. A longtime journalist, and newly minted master of social work (MSW), Lily Casura conducts macro-level research, performs data analysis, and studies policy implications regarding poverty, equity, education and homelessness, particularly regarding students and female veterans. 

Lily founded the first website about combat veterans and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). In 2016, she received a Howard G. Buffett inaugural grant from the International Women's Media Foundation to create a multimedia reporting project around female veteran homelessness. She is a chapter author in "Healing War Trauma: A Handbook of Creative Approaches" (Routledge, 2012).

She is an honors graduate of Harvard University, with additional training from the Center for Mind-Body Medicine (Washington, DC) and the National Center for PTSD (VA), and is a member of APHA, NASW, Journalism and Women Symposium (JAWS), Association of Health Care Journalists (AHCJ), and the Alamo Regional Data Alliance. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Has the Washington establishment failed the world? | David Rothkopf | TEDxMidAtlantic
video_description:
Longtime Washington insider David Rothkopf looks back on his forty year career in Washington, D.C., and asks a basic question: did Washington fail to lead? He argues that political expedience may have come at the expense of actually addressing real problems that have continued to fester in both domestic and foreign policy, with devastating societal and economic consequences. He also offers some ideas about what we can do now to improve things, and how we might avoid ending up here again. David Rothkopf is the CEO of The Rothkopf Group, a media and advisory company. Via its DSR Network it is a leading presenter of podcast and other web-based content on politics, foreign policy, national security and technology. Rothkopf is a well-known author whose next book Traitor: The Case Against Donald Trump is due out later this year from St. Martin’s Press.

His prior books include “National Insecurity”, “Power, Inc.”, “Superclass” and “Running the World: The National Security Council and the Architects of American Power.” He is also the author of “The Great Questions of Tomorrow” from Simon & Schuster and TED Books, based on his TED talk which has been seen to date by well over a million viewers.

He was previously editor and CEO of the FP Group, publishers of Foreign Policy Magazine, managing director of Kissinger Associates and served as a senior official in the Commerce Department. He has taught at the schools of international affairs at Columbia University, Johns Hopkins and Georgetown. He is a regular columnist and contributor to major newspapers, websites and broadcast outlets worldwide. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Neuroscience of Learning & Mental Health | Prof. Marios Philiastides | TEDxUniversityofGlasgow
video_description: Marios Philiastides is a Full Professor at the Institute of Neuroscience and Psychology at the University of Glasgow. His research group uses multimodal brain imaging to understand the neurobiological principles underlying human decision making and learning in both healthy and clinical populations. Marios Philiastides is a Full Professor at the Institute of Neuroscience and Psychology at the University of Glasgow. His research group uses multimodal brain imaging to understand the neurobiological principles underlying human decision making and learning in both healthy and clinical populations. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Future - Ready Through Creativity | Vijay Rao | TEDxNIITUniversity
video_description:
A multi-disciplinary Educator and remote learning expert with a global following, Mr. Vijay Rao speaks that Creativity and Critical thinking are the safest routes to future jobs.

Rao gives an example of injecting Arts into STEM making STEAM, performed by his Vanguard Achvrz Academy at the American Center with NASA Project head as Chief Guest. Drawn from hundreds of schools, students trained by Mr. Rao have gained worldwide recognition, performing the world's first musical theatre shows based on the Olympics and Disaster-preparedness for tsunamis.  His exceptionally diverse skillset, which ranges from cover stories with accurate share price predictions to workshops on public speaking and enhancing soft skills, serves as a figure of inspiration for our young audiences.

 Mr. Rao's stage performance group, named "The Achievers," which comprises of the children from 35 schools across Delhi, have performed the world's first musical theatre show based on the tsunami, titled "Trump of the Human Spirit" gained worldwide recognition. His exceptionally diverse skillset, which ranges from cover stories with accurate share price predictions to workshops on public speaking and enhancing soft skills, serves as a figure of inspiration for our young audiences. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: What If Color Is the Answer? | Maggie O'Neill | TEDxPearlStreet
video_description:
What if color is the answer? To gather data on this question, artist Maggie O’Neill explores the ways we can use color theory as a lens or methodology to help us overcome adversity and better understand our relationships. Through her own journey of self-discovery, Maggie shows us how she came to see others other through this lens, and found news ways to become more inspired – and less scared – of others. According to Maggie, by uncovering your true colors and living in the truth of your color you can begin to understand your super power as a human being, and discover a new way to see the world and handle adversity a little differently. 

SPEAKER BIO: Maggie O’Neill is an artist, designer and creative entrepreneur based in Washington, DC. As a fine artist, Maggie is best known for her iconic pop impressionistic paintings of Washington, DC including landmarks and both the famous and familiar individuals who inspire and make history.  hold for bio This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: How Robot Armies Will Save Our Future Cities | Kaveh Akbari Hamed | TEDxPearlStreet
video_description:
Until now, engineers, mathematicians, and  
roboticists have worked together to build and  
move single robots. Unfortunately, one single robot isn’t enough to do the work our future demands. 

Our world faces complex challenges every day – whether industrial accidents, natural disasters, or self inflicted catastrophes — these are circumstances that compromise the safety of the human beings that are regularly deployed to manage the crisis. In order to reduce the risk to human armies, engineers like Dr. Kaveh Akbari Hamed have studied new models to understand how to build more agile and collaborative robots that can work together to mitigate crises and keep humans from harms way.

In this fascinating talk, Dr. Hamed describes how he found the inspiration to solve the complex problem of building an army of collaborative robots in and around his home.

SPEAKER BIO: 

Dr. Kaveh Akbari Hamed is an Assistant Professor and Director of the Hybrid Dynamic Systems and Robot Locomotion (HDSRL) Laboratory in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at Virginia Tech. His primary academic interests span control theory, robotics, cyber-physical systems, hybrid dynamical systems, and optimization. hold for bio This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Changing Perspectives on Sex, Gender, Humanity, and the World | Kand McQueen | TEDxBloomington
video_description: As a people, we have chosen to obsess upon our differences and exclude those who do not fit our conventional categorizations despite our common humanity. In this presentation, Dr. Kand McQueen suggests four perspectival shifts that together formulate an alternative to this polarization. The result is a broader and richer conceptualization of humanity; one that has room for all persons, everywhere. Live recording and post-production of this talk was done by Jon Stante Video Developer and Creator. Kand McQueen is a nationally-recognized keynote speaker on issues of gender identity. Beginning while still a graduate student, Dr. McQueen has been speaking on this topic for over 18 years to a variety of student, professional, and community audiences in settings ranging from academic conferences and high school, college, and university campuses to mental health centers, churches, synagogues and community forums to appearances on community radio and public television. Dr. McQueen earned a Ph.D. in Educational Psychology with a specialization in Inquiry Methodology from Indiana University’s School of Education, and formerly served as graduate faculty at two universities. Dr. McQueen is committed to educating about the existence of those who fall outside the dichotomous categories of male and female, and in the process, facilitate societal understanding and acceptance of all human beings. For more information, see www.kandmcqueen.com This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Όνειρα χωρίς όρια- γράψε την ιστορία σου μόνος σου | Alexandra Kollarou | TEDxMoraitisSchool
video_description:
Η ομιλία της Αλεξάνδρας Κολλάρου παρουσιάζει τον κατασταλτικό ρόλο του κοινωνικού κατεστημένου στην προσωπική μας ζωή, εξηγώντας ότι η προσωπική ολοκλήρωση μπορεί να επέλθει μόνο αν ακολουθήσουμε τον δικό μας δρόμο.

Η Αλεξάνδρα Κολλάρου γεννήθηκε στην Αθήνα, σπούδασε Τέχνη και Design στο Λονδίνο και στη Φλωρεντία. Σήμερα ασχολείται με τη συγγραφή, την προώθηση της σύγχρονης τέχνης και την εξερεύνηση του κόσμου. Είναι ιδρύτρια του artAZ, της πρώτης online πλατφόρμας τέχνης της Ελλάδας, ενώ τα τελευταία 25 χρόνια διοργανώνει και επιμελείται εκθέσεις και εικαστικές δράσεις στην Ελλάδα και στο εξωτερικό, έχοντας παρουσιάσει παράλληλα τη δική της δουλειά σε 4 ατομικές εκθέσεις. Διατηρεί το blog “The Real Queen of Stuff”, αρθρογραφεί με θέμα την τέχνη και το design και έχει γράψει και εικονογραφήσει το βιβλίο “Η Ελληνική Τέχνη από το Α έως το Ω”.

 Η Αλεξάνδρα Κολλάρου γεννήθηκε στην Αθήνα, σπούδασε Τέχνη και Design στο Λονδίνο και στη Φλωρεντία, και σήμερα ασχολείται με την προώθηση της σύγχρονης τέχνης, τη συγγραφή και την εξερεύνηση του κόσμου. Είναι ιδρύτρια (2007) του artAZ, της πρώτης online πλατφόρμας τέχνης της Ελλάδας, ενώ τα τελευταία 25 χρόνια διοργανώνει και επιμελείται εκθέσεις και εικαστικές δράσεις στην Ελλάδα, Ευρώπη, Αμερική και Λατινική Αμερική και έχει παρουσιάσει δική της δουλειά σε 4 ατομικές εκθέσεις. Χρησιμοποιεί την τέχνη για να
κάνει τη ζωή πιο όμορφη και έχει ιδρύσει 2 φιλανθρωπικές εκστρατείες: το Girl Power (2002-2005) για την ενίσχυση του αγώνα ενάντια στον καρκίνο του μαστού, και την ΕΚΠΛΗΞΗ (2009-2019), για την υποστήριξη των αστέγων της Αθήνας. Διατηρεί το blog «The Real Queen of Stuff», αρθρογραφεί με θέμα την τέχνη και το design, και έχει γράψει και εικονογραφήσει το βιβλίο «Η Ελληνική Τέχνη από το Α έως το Ω» (Key Books, 2018). This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Living the Dream | Saufi Aiman | TEDxKenyalang
video_description: We can choose to accept our circumstances, or we can choose to make the effort to rise above them. That choice usually starts with what you believe about yourself and your dream. And what all of these success stories have in common is that someone, somewhere, started working toward a dream or goal before they knew where it would go. In this talk, Saufi Aiman shared more details on "Living the Dream." Saufi, the founder of Sape'star, a brand that strives in positioning Sape' in the local & global commercial market through musical performance, retails of instruments & music education. He is a professional musician, music instructor, co-author for Traditional Music Instrument: Sape' (DBP), & author for Sape' method books. Due to that, he was the Champion of the world Instrumentalist award for classical, contemporary & open category and also bagged 4 gold medals & 1 silver medal during the 21st Annual World Championship of Performing Arts in 2017. WCOPA is an international competition for aspiring performers and ent entainers held annually  in Long Beach, California(USA). This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Music: The Side You Might Not Know | Mario Saied | TEDxZagazig
video_description:
“The music is all around us, all you have to do.. is listen” 
The history of music is the history of humans; every Piece of music tells us a story about war, peace, love, hope, rise, or fall.

With Mario's remarkable performance and adorable rhythms, we are taken on a trip through history and told a lot of stories.

بنوتة موسيقية واحدة يمكننا أن نسافر عبر الأمكنة والأزمنة؛ يأخذنا ماريو سعيد في رحلة داخل عالم الموسيقى والنغمات، ويتحدث عن تأثرها بالعلوم الأخرى وماهية العلاقة بينها وبين تاريخ الحضارة البشرية والإنسانية. Mario Saied,
An oud player and music composer. He graduated from the Arabic Oud House under the supervision of the world-famous musician “Naseer Shamma” with a very good grade, then he started his job as a trainer in the Arabic Oud house after his graduation. He has many musical compositions and created his band "soul" with whom he played at many concerts besides his solo concerts. He also has many interests in music therapy and its impact and evolution overages. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Learning To Love | Renata Giarola | TEDxMarin
video_description:
Renata gives us a big idea on why we should teach young adults the skill to succeed in love relationships.
In  her free time, she  write about the brain, love, longevity, suffering, and the human condition.
She shares her thoughts on  Medium  and on  my newsletter.
More Info (https://renatagiarola.com) In  her free time, she writes about the brain, love, longevity, suffering, and the human condition. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Future Medicine | Daniel Kraft | TEDxMarin
video_description:
Covid-fueled and soon-to-be-released medical technologies will dramatically optimize our health-spans.
Daniel Kraft is a Stanford and Harvard trained physician-scientist, inventor, entrepreneur, and innovator and is serving as the Chair of the  XPRIZE Pandemic Alliance Task Force. With over 25 years of experience in clinical practice, biomedical research and healthcare innovation, Kraft has chaired the Medicine for  Singularity University since its inception in 2008, and is founder and chair of  Exponential Medicine, a program that explores convergent, rapidly developing technologies and their potential in biomedicine and healthcare. He is often called upon to speak to the future of health, medicine and technology and has given 5 TED and TEDMED Talks.

More info https://danielkraftmd.net Daniel Kraft is a Stanford and Harvard trained physician-scientist, inventor, entrepreneur, and innovator and is serving as the Chair of the XPRIZE Pandemic Alliance Task Force. With over 25 years of experience in clinical practice, biomedical research and healthcare innovation, Kraft has chaired the Medicine for  Singularity University  since its inception in 2008, and is founder and chair of  Exponential Medicine, a program that explores convergent, rapidly developing technologies and their potential in biomedicine and healthcare. He is often called upon to speak to the future of health, medicine and technology and has given 5 TED and TEDMED Talks. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Pasión por el BeatBox | José Hasbún | TEDxSantoDomingo
video_description:
Comenzó a experimentar música a la edad de 10 años, a través de los juegos electrónicos como el “Rock Band”. Encuentra su verdadera pasión cuando conoce el mundo de los “beatboxers” de Inglaterra, Japón hasta Sudáfrica a través de Youtube, entrando en contacto con algunos y atraído por el género decidió aprender por sí solo las técnicas y convertirse en uno de ellos! .
Beatboxing es la recreación de patrones de ritmo y los sonidos musicales usando sólo la boca, los labios y las cuerdas vocales. Se originó en su forma moderna a principios de 1980 con la cultura Hip Hop y Rap. Comenzó a experimentar música a la edad de 10 años, a través de los juegos electrónicos como el “Rock Band”. Encuentra su verdadera pasión cuando conoce el mundo de los “beatboxers” de Inglaterra, Japón hasta Sudáfrica a través de Youtube, entrando en contacto con algunos y atraído por el género decidió aprender por sí solo las técnicas y convertirse en uno de ellos! .
Beatboxing es la recreación de patrones de ritmo y los sonidos musicales usando sólo la boca, los labios y las cuerdas vocales. Se originó en su forma moderna a principios de 1980 con la cultura Hip Hop y Rap. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Guide de survie dans une foule en panique | Mehdi Moussaïd | TEDxPoitiers
video_description:
Comment réagit la foule en situation d’urgence ? Comment se propage la panique au sein d’un groupe ?  Quel est l’effet du stress sur notre comportement collectif ?  Dans les médias, au cinéma et dans notre imaginaire, la foule abrutie les individus et leur fait perdre toute notion d’humanité. Mais depuis quelques années, la science en dresse une image bien différente, celle d’une foule solidaire et parfois même intelligente… 
 Mehdi Moussaïd est chercheur spécialisé dans l’étude du comportement des foules, lauréat du prix Le Monde de la recherche et vulgarisateur scientifique sur sa chaîne Youtube “Fouloscopie” qui cumule 200 000 abonnés. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Le HQI, entre Spleen et Idéal | Philippe Mouillot | TEDxPoitiers
video_description: Être HQI c'est un étrange cadeau de la vie. On ne le choisit pas. Parfois on ne le comprend même pas. Mais on ne peut pas le rendre. Alors autant apprendre à l'aimer… Philippe Mouillot est Maître de Conférences Habilité à Diriger des Recherches universitaires. Détecté HQI (Haut Quotient Intellectuel) par Mensa France à l'âge de 25 ans, il dédie aujourd'hui la plupart de ses recherches scientifiques à l'accompagnement des étudiants et des adultes HQI pour les aider et les encourager à mieux vivre leur différence. C'est pour eux qu'il a accepté de relever le défi de TED. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Les pouvoirs ordinaires du langage | Joona Karijoki | TEDxPoitiers
video_description: C'est au travers de l'apprentissage de langues, notamment lorsqu'il débarque en France à l'âge de six ans, que Joona commence à s'interroger sur les effets que le langage peut avoir sur nos vies. A quel point peut-il nous limiter ? Peut-il aussi nous donner des ailes ? Il monte sur scène pour nous partager ses expériences, ses convictions et ses astuces pour en faire le meilleur usage possible. Joona, passionné par les mots et intrigué par leurs histoires" This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: La manche à la nage ou comment réaliser un objectif ambitieux ? | Gregor Ozbolt | TEDxPoitiers
video_description: "Le voyage vaut autant que la destination". C'est avec ce postulat paternel que Grégor vous livre l'incroyable voyage pour arriver à la réalisation de la traversée de la manche à la nage. En chiffres, ce sont 42 km dans une eau à 16 °c avec un taux d'échec de 85%. Son objectif, vous questionnez et vous donnez des clés pour vous réaliser. Le coach nous exprime sans tabou ses espoirs, ses inspirations, ses doutes, ses peurs ainsi que les apprentissages qui lui ont permis de concrétiser l'un de ses rêves. Grégor  Ozbolt est un entrepreneur et coach en développement personnel francophone. Il épaule les personnes qui désirent enfin occuper la place à laquelle ils aspirent en les aidant à mettre en œuvre les moyens pour y parvenir. Qu'ils soient CEO, artistes, intrapreneurs, étudiants ou encore militants écologistes, il les accompagne pour atteindre l'épanouissement dans leur entreprise, leur style ou encore leur impact environnemental. Il a mené un vaste travail d'interviews de personnes remarquables dans leur domaine pour tester, itérer et créer les meilleurs programmes de coaching This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Pratiquer le massage bien-être : une évidence après mon E.M.I | Betty Neault | TEDxPoitiers
video_description: Si, donner des soins bien-être est une vocation pour d'autre, pour moi, c'est une manière de transmettre et vivre des ressentis. Combattante de la vie ! This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: A gente é aquilo que a gente espalha | Marc Tawil | TEDxSaoPaulo
video_description: Atitudes aparentemente ordinárias podem nos levar a lugares extraordinários. Após uma experiência vivida, em 2018, no sistema público de saúde, Marc Tawil confirmou uma crença: que cada um de nós merece ser respeitado, reconhecido e valorizado não pelo que tem, e sim por quem é. A gente é aquilo que a gente espalha, e não aquilo que a gente acumula. E, para que isso se cristalize de maneira legítima, devemos enxergar aqueles que os outros se recusam enxergar, ainda que os vejam. Escutar aqueles que os outros se recusam escutar, ainda que os ouçam. Porque a beleza da vida está justamente na generosidade, em dividir o nosso placo com outros protagonistas. Marc Tawil é jornalista, empreendedor, estrategista de comunicação, escritor e filantropo. Fundador da Tawil Comunicação, agência premiada por seu viés humanitário. Colunista de Época Negócios, host do podcast Autoperformance na Jovem Pan e conselheiro da Revista HSM, ele está diretamente envolvido com a causa dos refugiados e de pessoas com deficiência física e intelectual. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Worüber keiner so wirklich redet:T1-Diabetes | Viktoria Wrona | TEDxYouth@ESRM
video_description: Schwerpunkte des Vortrages sind die alltäglichen Herausforderungen mit dieser Erkrankung, sowie die Vorurteile gegenüber dem Typ-1 Diabetes. Zudem werden verbundene monatliche Kosten sowie Ernährungsbeispiele aufgelistet. Der Vortrag soll zudem ein Verständnis für den Typ-1 Diabetes vermitteln und das Umfeld eines Erkrankten für auftretende Symptome sensibilisieren. Born and raised in Germany, but with Polish and Russian roots, Viktoria believes in helping others and supporting them to achieve their goals. She works hard to support inclusivity in school and ensure there is awareness of difference and a celebration of diversity. Her topic for her TED talk is personal, as she wishes to draw attention to Type 1 Diabetes. She knows too well the struggles and issues that she and others experience on a daily basis. Her hopes for the future are to make the world a happier and more inclusive place, whilst not shying away from the difficult topic of discrimination. She will share the truth and ensure that we keep smiling. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: The Aspect of Change | Jaskaran Singh | TEDxYouth@ESRM
video_description: The speaker tells his life story with specific reference to how he chose to step out of his comfort zone, in order to grow as a person. The aim of this talk is to inspire others to embrace change and not be afraid of hard work. Born and brought up in Delhi, India Jaskaran has adapted quickly to life in Germany.  He has lived in Germany for the past 4 years and in this short time completed his exams, learnt German and has been awarded the “Frankfurt School Spirit Award” and a prestigious scholarship (Konrad Adenauer Stiftung). Due to his tireless hard work and inspirational dedication to work and the community he has also been awarded the “Outstanding Personality” award by the state of Hessen. He continues to promote positive values towards academic growth and a caring commitment towards all those he meets. He values people from different backgrounds and has a strong desire to understand their culture and mindset. These values he embodies in his life and has led him to the topic for his TED talk on the emancipation of the mind and dealing with change. Jaskaran has achieved so much and it’s only the beginning. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Doing Something About Doing Nothing | Mona Hilliges | TEDxYouth@ESRM
video_description: This talk explains the apparent apathy of previous generations towards global environmental issues, and calls today`s young generation to step up and take action. Mona was born in Washington D.C., USA, but has lived most of her life in Frankfurt, Germany and New Delhi, India. As a keen volunteer and member of the Model United Nations team at the European School Rhein-Main, Mona’s passions include politics, singing, swimming and sports. She also volunteers with multiple organisations, including working with children and teens at her local church. Mona is a passionate climate activist with a strong interest in humanitarian issues. She hopes to inspire individuals and politicians to take action against climate change. Her goals include studying at a top university and working for an organisation where she can use her voice to make change and help others. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Sucht nach Elektronikgeräten | Alvaro Bast Lopez | TEDxYouth@ESRM
video_description:
Werden Kinder heutzutage süchtig nach Elektronikgeräten? Schwerpunkte des Vortrages sind die Analyse von Vor- sowie Nachteilen in Bezug auf die Nutzung technischer Geräte und die Reflexion des eigenen Verhaltens. Zudem werden alltägliche Beispiele integriert.
 Reading the news too often? On social media for hours at a time? You may be addicted to your electronic devices. Young and upcoming Alvaro Hans Bast Lopez will be bracing his audience with some ideas about as to why this is a 21st century issue. Being only 10 years old, this European Schule RheinMain student grew up in both Italy and Germany and has come to realize that this issue affects the typical global citizen on a day-to-day basis. In his spare time outside of his studies, Alvaro enjoys a good game of tennis. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: On real estate brokerage market in Mongolia | Batgerel Batsaikhan | TEDxUlaanbaatarSalon
video_description: In this talk, Batgerel shares insights on current and future trends of Mongolian real estate market. Batgerel Batsaikhan is the CEO of Bridge Association of Real Estate, Mongolia. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: On life and its true value | Batkhuyag Lkhagvasuren | TEDxUlaanbaatarSalon
video_description: Batkhuyag is raising a disabled child and has even overcome a cancer. In this talk, he shares how the worst hardships in life helped him to reconsider its true value. Batkhuyag Lkhagvasuren is a co-Founder of Moncon Group and the CEO of Moncon Properties LLC, Mongolia. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: How you should use opportunity | Bujinlkham Bold | TEDxUlaanbaatarSalon
video_description: In her talk, Bujinlkham shares how she saw opportunities as something one should grasp and develop into meaningful results. Bujinlkham Bold works as the CEO of Nano International LLC and Regional Owner of RE/MAX Mongolia. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Best hits | The Colors | TEDxUlaanbaatarSalon
video_description: The band performed live at TEDxUlaanbaatarSalon. The Colors is a well-known Mongolian band. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: 5 Major Reasons Religion Is the No.1 Cause of Poverty in Africa | Rev Walter Mwambazi | TEDxLusaka
video_description: One of the greatest enigmas of our time that begs an explanation is how a continent endowed with so much wealth and resources (human, food, mineral and land) can be so poor as to have 16 of the 20 poorest nations on earth. Hard discussions on this perennial African development question are ignited by Rev Walter in this talk, where he suggests that religion and its cascading effects is the biggest obstacle to development. He also proposes a solution to how Africans can free themselves from religious slavery! Reverend Walter Mwambazi is chiefly a thought transformation leader, but he is also a networker, digital & traditional marketer, published author, newspaper columnist, blogger, neural-linguistic and cognitive enhancement coach, radio & television personality and a social influencer. Before all this, he was an ordained and in-service minister for 5 years. Reverend Walter is married with 3 children. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: El éxito es amar lo que haces en negocios y en la vida. | Luis Sánchez Noble | TEDxSantoDomingo
video_description: Una figura icónica en el ecosistema emprendedor y de negocios dominicanos, Don Luis es una verdadera fuerza de cambio e impacto desde hace casi 60 años. En 1962, creó su primera empresa, la cual aún opera con éxito. Cual Rey Midas de la innovación y la calidad, todo lo que toca se transforma para bien. Así, su paso como Presidente en dos ocasiones de la Asociación de Empresas Industriales de Herrera, dejó el legado de las Tertulias de Herrera, la Feria Industrial de Herrera y el Premio Anual a la Calidad de la Industria Nacional. Su compromiso en el empresariado transformador se manifiesta desde sus mismos inicios como fundador de la Cámara Junior o Jaycees y en los años 70 al desarrollar procesos para fomentar la creatividad y cultura emprendedora a través del Instituto de Capacitación Profesional (ICAP). Pero sus méritos se extienden más allá del gremio empresarial como presidente de Acción por la Educación (EDUCA), Director de la Comisión de Educación del Consejo Nacional de la Empresa Privada (CONEP) y asesor del Ministerio de Educación Superior, Ciencia y Tecnología. Es esta pasión por la educación y el servicio a los jóvenes la que hace que su blanca cabellera se encuentre a gusto y sea recibida con entusiasmo por jóvenes estudiantes y emprendedores de todo el país a través de los talleres, conferencias y programas que se imparten a través de su más preciado emprendimiento: La Fundación Innovati. Una figura icónica en el ecosistema emprendedor y de negocios dominicanos, Don Luis es una verdadera fuerza de cambio e impacto desde hace casi 60 años. En 1962, creó su primera empresa, la cual aún opera con éxito. Cual Rey Midas de la innovación y la calidad, todo lo que toca se transforma para bien. Así, su paso como Presidente en dos ocasiones de la Asociación de Empresas Industriales de Herrera, dejó el legado de las Tertulias de Herrera, la Feria Industrial de Herrera y el Premio Anual a la Calidad de la Industria Nacional. Su compromiso en el empresariado transformador se manifiesta desde sus mismos inicios como fundador de la Cámara Junior o Jaycees y en los años 70 al desarrollar procesos para fomentar la creatividad y cultura emprendedora a través del Instituto de Capacitación Profesional (ICAP). Pero sus méritos se extienden más allá del gremio empresarial como presidente de Acción por la Educación (EDUCA), Director de la Comisión de Educación del Consejo Nacional de la Empresa Privada (CONEP) y asesor del Ministerio de Educación Superior, Ciencia y Tecnología. Es esta pasión por la educación y el servicio a los jóvenes la que hace que su blanca cabellera se encuentre a gusto y sea recibida con entusiasmo por jóvenes estudiantes y emprendedores de todo el país a través de los talleres, conferencias y programas que se imparten a través de su más preciado emprendimiento: La Fundación Innovati. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Les oubliés de l’histoire de l’Art. | François Maillet | TEDxPoitiers
video_description: On a tous l’impression que l’histoire est une chose figée, immuable et parfois un peu poussiéreuse. Pourtant, s’il est une vérité, c’est que la pratique de l’Histoire est avant tout un perpétuel questionnement du passé, tout n’est que mouvement. Des questions, l’historien de l’Art Francois Maillet s’en pose quelques unes. Il considère sa pratique de l’histoire hors des sentiers battus. Il nous fait découvrir une histoire des artistes oubliés, une vision au sens large où chacun peut, à son échelle, changer le futur. Jeune historien This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Mujer, Indígena y lideresa transformacional | Aura Leticia Teleguario | TEDxLlorenteWomen
video_description:
Una crisis es una oportunidad cuando buscamos las estrategias y mecanismos para transformarla. Aura Leticia Teleguario, mujer indígena guatemalteca sobreviviente del conflicto armado, nos cuenta el camino que construyó para convertir sus circunstancias difíciles en nuevas oportunidades. Aura Leticia Teleguario Sincal, es guatemalteca, Maya Kaqchikel, con licenciatura y maestría en Administración de Empresas. Cuenta con posgrados en
Administración Pública, Liderazgo, Innovación, Género, Juventud, y Multiculturalidad. Actualmente es parte del programa de Liderazgo Político y Público, Oportunidades Económicas y Derechos Humanos de Voces Vitales Washington. Habla Kaqchikel (idioma Maya), español e inglés. 

Actualmente es Asesora Especial en Relaciones Inter-Agenciales, Públicas y Corporativas de ONU Mujer. Es parte del Consejo Asesor de Plan Internacional y Voces Vitales Guatemala. Asimismo, es pare del Central American Leadership Initiative del Aspen Institute y de la red latinoamericana de ex alumnos de la Universidad de Georgetown.

Es consultora nacional e internacional en temas relacionados con derechos de los pueblos indígenas, empoderamiento económico, migración, nutrición, empleo, seguridad social, educación y derechos de los jóvenes y las mujeres.

En enero del 2016 asumió el cargo de Ministra de Trabajo y Previsión Social, convirtiéndose en la primera mujer indígena en la historia de Guatemala en ser nombrada para este ministerio. Es importante destacar que debido a los temas coyunturales que atraviesa Guatemala, renunció al cargo de ministra en septiembre del 2018.

Durante veintidós años fue funcionaria de varios programas de la Agencia de los Estados Unidos para el Desarrollo Internacional -USAID- y la Embajada de los Estados Unidos en Guatemala. Su último cargo fue como Asesora en Temas de Pueblos Indígenas, espacio en el que promovió programas que contribuyeron al desarrollo
integral e incluyente del país. Como lideresa, profesional e indígena, asimismo, por su trayectoria e incidencia en el sector público, económico y social, su liderazgo ha sido reconocido a nivel nacional e internacional. La Revista Estrategia y Negocios de C.A. y Look Magazine la visibilizan entre las 26 mujeres líderes de Centroamérica y las 12 más influyentes de Guatemala. Su visión es contribuir para que Guatemala y los países de Latinoamérica sean más prósperos, incluyentes, justos, equitativos y transparentes. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Su voz y piano llamando a las estrellas | Mia Guier | TEDxLlorenteWomen
video_description:
Mia es una cantante y pianista costarricense que a su corta edad, nos deleita con su talento y nos invita a seguir soñando por un mundo mejor. 

Bohemian Rhapsody / Killer Queen - Queen
El Sol y La Flor - Gandhi
Girl on Fire - Alicia Keys
 Mia Guier, nació en San José Costa Rica, el 24 de abril del 2008. Se desarrolló en un ambiente musical y artístico, ya que su padre es Abel Guier, bajista de la banda Gandhi. Empezó a estudiar piano en la Academia de Música Bansbach a los 7 años.  En el 2017, Mia y su hermana Claudia se integraron a la banda de niños de el guitarrista Andrey Ramírez (The Dorians).  Se han presentado en giras colegiales, teatros y diversos festivales, así como en la Teletón 2017 y en TEDxPuraVidaJoven 2018 en Parque Viva.   
En el 2018 pasado Mia participó en el Festival Estudiantil de las Artes (FEA) y ganó el premio como cantautora por su canción “De Colores”. 
En el año 2019 grabaron el vídeo de la canción original Invencibles como parte de una campaña de redes en contra del bullying infantil. También participó en el concurso de talentos de Kidzania y fue seleccionada entre unos 300 niños para la gran final.  Ganó el segundo lugar luego de presentar su cover de la canción Bohemian Rhapsody/Killer Queen de la banda Queen. 
Actualmente, cursa el 6to grado y estudia canto y piano con la profesora Andrea López.
 
En palabras de Mia:  
“Me gusta la música porque me permite hacer lo que a mí más me llena y a la vez puedo compartirlo con mis amigos y con las demás personas”. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Using the One Health Approach to Fight Disease X | Katendi Changula | TEDxLusaka
video_description: In the last few decades, the world has seen an increase in new infectious diseases, with the majority of these affecting both humans and animals. In this talk, Katendi speaks about using the One Health approach to fight infectious diseases and predict potential outbreaks. Dr. Katendi Changula is a veterinarian and an avid researcher, looking at diseases that affect both humans and animals. She studies bat populations in Zambia to detect the pathogens they carry, to determine the risk of spill-over of these infections into human populations and to develop new diagnostic tests for these diseases. She has worked with the Zambia Ministry of Health in the laboratory diagnosis of suspected cases of Ebola virus disease and COVID-19. She holds a Doctor of Philosophy in Diagnostic Veterinary Medicine, a Master of Science in Tropical Animal Health and a Bachelor of Veterinary Medicine degree. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Unlocking Your Inner Robot | Chung Hyuk Park | TEDxPearlStreet
video_description:
Dr. Chung Hyuk Park has always been fascinated by robots. However, it was through observing how children with disabilities connected with our robots that he discovered how to unlock his own potential as well as that of the robots he designs. In this deeply personal talk, Dr. Park shares his journey in developing robotic technology as well as the mutual understanding and growth he has experienced through his work to create technology that can improve the well-being of human society.

SPEAKER BIO:

Dr. Chung Hyuk Park is an Associate Professor in Biomedical Engineering at George Washington University. His interests include Interactive Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning. One of his primary goals as a roboticist is to design intelligent robotic systems that can assist people with disabilities, in rehabilitation, and with emotional and social interactions for the well-being of human society. hold for bio This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Silky Jazz Saxophone | Davey Yarborough & Na'Vaughn Marting | TEDxPearlStreet
video_description:
Smooth jazz saxophone instrumental of "Silky" performed by legendary jazz musician Davey Yarborough and his protegé Na'Vaughn Martin. This performance includes a discussion of the performance as well as the power of mentorship by the artists.

ABOUT THE PERFORMERS:

Davey Yarborough is the President and Artistic Director of The Washington Jazz Arts in Washington DC. In 2019, Mr. Yarborough retired from Duke Ellington School of the Arts after 30 years of service as jazz educator. His lifelong commitment to mentoring young musicians was recognized in 2018 when he was inducted into the Downbeat Jazz Educator Hall of Fame.

​Na’Vaughn Martin is an entrepreneur, educator and jazz musician based in Washington DC. He is founder and band leader of the Na’Vaughn Martin Trio, and he travels around the world to perform with Niigata’s Big Band Jazz Quest in different events and competitions as 1st tenor saxophonist. hold for bio

hold for bio This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: A Lot Can Happen in 10 Years | Kwame Onwuachi | TEDxPearlStreet
video_description:
Chef Kwame Onwuachi has never been afraid to share both his successes and his failures with the world. 

In this inspiring talk, he shares how much ambition has shaped him as an entrepreneur and culinary innovator. It’s what has always pushed him forward, whether he was selling candy on the subway or launching his own catering company at the age of 20. 

We learn how his entrepreneurial spirit, determination and grit kept him pushing to the top, as he shares his story and shows us how he overcame failure and loss to emerge as one of the top chefs in the culinary world.

SPEAKER BIO:

Chef Kwame Onwuachi is an American-Nigerian chef and  best-selling author. Most recently, he was the executive chef at Kith/Kin, a high-end Afro-Caribbean restaurant in The Wharf neighborhood of Washington, DC. He has been a contestant on Top Chef, and has been recognized by Food & Wine magazine, Esquire magazine, and the James Beard Foundation as "Rising Star Chef of the Year." hold for bio This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
